name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: In the past two days, there have been many crowd demonstrations against Yoon Seok-yeol on the streets of Seoul.

content: Lee Jae-myung, a member of the National Assembly and representative of the opposition Democratic Party of Korea, was giving a speech. He said, "We must hold our seats in the National Assembly until the president announces the lifting of martial law."

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: At this moment, people in South Korea are calling for the imprisonment of South Korean President Yoon Seok-yeol.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: People outside the building cheered. The president's power was at this moment limited by the legal framework.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: Despite the soldiers' obstruction, all the congressmen climbed over the wall and entered the Congress. After entering the Congress, they quickly set up roadblocks and quickly voted to pass a plenary meeting to lift martial law.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: South Korean opposition leader Lee Jae-myung announced that Yoon Seok-yeol is no longer fit to serve as South Korean president and called on supporters to come to the parliament to protest.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: During the dispute, the soldier pointed a gun at the Democratic Party spokesperson An Guiling

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: Due to the emergency martial law, all entertainment activities in South Korea were cancelled and patrolling police could be seen everywhere on the streets.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: South Korean opposition leader Lee Jae-myung announced that Yoon Seok-yeol is no longer fit to serve as South Korean president and called on supporters to come to parliament to protest.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: South Korea's parliament will try to lift the president's martial law order, but the military may try to arrest lawmakers. Lee Jae-myung, leader of South Korea's largest opposition party, said that parliament will try to lift South Korean President Yoon Seok-yeol's martial law order, but the military may try to arrest lawmakers.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: South Korea's National Assembly passed a resolution to lift martial law. South Korea's National Assembly held an emergency plenary session in the early morning of the 4th to vote on the "lifting of martial law". 190 members attended the meeting and voted in favor. South Korea's National Assembly Speaker Woo Won-sik then announced that the emergency martial law order was invalid.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: In front of the Congress, people chanted, "Lift martial law! Overthrow the dictatorship!"

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: The Korean movie "Seoul Spring" topped the Weibo entertainment hot search list.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: The martial law troops that entered the Capitol began to withdraw.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: South Korea's parliament voted 190-0 to lift martial law... South Korean soldiers began to leave the parliament, and protesters cheered.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: On the evening of December 3, as President Yoon Seok-yeol announced the emergency martial law, soldiers from the Capital Defense Command took a bus to the main gate of the National Assembly. Just as they were about to enter, they were stopped by the citizens of Seoul. The citizens' delay also successfully helped all the members of the National Assembly to climb over the wall and enter the National Assembly in time for the plenary session.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: Lawmakers said they would remain in Congress until the president lifted martial law.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: At present, several armored vehicles of the South Korean military were driving towards the National Assembly Building in Yeongdeungpo District, Seoul, South Korea, but were blocked by the public. Then, the military armored vehicles, escorted by several South Korean police officers, drove away from the protesting and obstructing crowd and drove towards the South Korean National Assembly Building.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: Seoul residents stopped an armored vehicle on the street as it pretended to leave and then tried to turn around and return to the National Assembly

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: Former South Korean President Moon Jae-in wrote: As the former commander-in-chief of the military, I have the following requirements for the military. The military must never make the same mistake against the people again. The military must not support unconstitutional coup propaganda. In particular, the military must not hinder the activities of the National Assembly and members of the National Assembly who have the constitutional power to demand the dissolution of martial law. The military should faithfully perform its duties at its post. The current task is to prevent the security crisis that may be caused by unconstitutional coup propaganda.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: South Korea's National Assembly prepares to impeach Yoon Seok-yeol About 40 South Korean lawmakers plan to introduce a bill to impeach President Yoon Seok-yeol on Wednesday, according to Yonhap News Agency. Other lawmakers, including some in leadership positions, have reportedly called on Yoon to resign immediately ahead of any impeachment proceedings.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: According to Yonhap News Agency, South Korean President Yoon Seok-yeol said that he would lift the martial law order after lawmakers voted down his order, but it was early in the morning and he could not lift the order immediately. He had to wait for the cabinet to reach the minimum attendance number before lifting it. Shortly afterwards, the cabinet voted to lift the martial law. Before the cabinet reached the designated attendance number to lift the martial law order, President Yoon issued a statement on the lifting of martial law: "Dear citizens:

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: According to the BBC, the military has withdrawn from the South Korean National Assembly and officials have removed furniture barricades in front of the parliament building after South Korean President Yoon Seok-yeol announced the lifting of martial law.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: BBC reports US State Department officials were caught off guard by President Yoon Seok-yeol's sudden declaration of martial law. The alliance between Washington and Seoul is crucial, with the US having nearly 30,000 troops in South Korea protecting it from its nuclear-armed northern neighbour. The State Department said Seoul's leadership took the drastic step without informing Washington in advance, an extremely rare move. The US said it had not been notified in advance of any martial law declaration.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: South Korea's largest union calls on its one million members to strike until President Yoon resigns BBC report The Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU), one of South Korea's largest labor unions, has called on its members to strike until President Yoon Seok-yeol resigns. In a post on Facebook, the union called Yoon's brief martial law declaration a crime of rebellion and called on its more than one million members to rally in Seoul and other areas on Wednesday morning to oppose the move.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: North Korea may take advantage of the political instability caused by the martial law declaration Daniel Russell, former US Assistant Secretary of State for East Asian and Pacific Affairs, told the BBC that North Korea is likely to take advantage of the political instability caused by President Yoon Seok-yeol's surprise declaration of martial law. Yoon initially claimed that the move was to protect the country from North Korean communist forces and eliminate "anti-national elements." Russell said this claim was "quite far-fetched."

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: South Korean opposition leader Lee Jae-myung live-streamed a video of himself climbing over the wall to vote in the National Assembly during martial law

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: South Korean President Yoon Seok-yeol's decision to introduce martial law has been strongly criticized by leaders of his own party. "As the ruling party, we deeply regret to the public," said Han Dong-hoon, leader of the People's Power Party, in a statement to reporters early Wednesday morning.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: This morning, a large number of South Koreans gathered outside the National Assembly to protest, and the protesters shouted: "Arrest Yoon Seok-yeol!"

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
South Korea's military said martial law will remain in effect until the president announces otherwise or officially lifts it.
The South Korean presidential office is discussing whether it can exercise its right to refuse to lift martial law

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Easley, a professor of international studies at Ewha Womans University in Seoul, analyzed that President Yoon's martial law declaration was "a legal overreach and a political miscalculation."
Easley further pointed out: "This may be more harmful to South Korea's domestic politics and international reputation than the destruction of the U.S. Capitol by rioters on January 6, 2021." At that time, rioters broke through barriers and ransacked the U.S. Capitol with the intention of preventing the certification of Joe Biden's presidential election.
Easley's evaluation of Yoon Seok-yeol is: "With extremely low public support and no strong support within his own party and government, the president should have known how difficult it would be to implement his late-night decree." He described Yoon Seok-yeol: "He looks like a besieged politician who made a desperate move to fight against the growing scandals, institutional obstruction and calls for impeachment, which may be exacerbated by this."
"North Korea may take a wait-and-see approach, but it cannot be ruled out...

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Last night, South Koreans tried to stop the military from climbing over the wall and entering the parliament.
This morning, police stopped protesters on the main road.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
South Korea's ruling party is discussing expelling President Yoon Seok-yeol from the party and demanding the resignation of all cabinet members who failed to prevent martial law
BBC reports President Yoon's People's Power Party is holding an emergency meeting to discuss the next steps after last night's chaos. The closed-door meeting began at 7 a.m. local time and was chaired by party leader Han Dong-hoon. The majority of the party's Supreme Council has agreed to ask Yoon Seok-yeol to leave the party to "protect the spirit of the constitution."
The meeting also unanimously demanded the resignation of all State Council members who failed to prevent martial law, as well as the dismissal of Defense Minister Kim Young-hyun, who proposed the idea of martial law.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
According to South Korean media reports, when withdrawing troops from the National Assembly, a fully armed soldier bowed and apologized to citizens and lawmakers.
Reporter í—ˆì¬í˜„ described a soldier who repeatedly bowed and said "I'm sorry" when he was questioned. He said: "In the brief moment when you chased me and bowed to me once, twice, and three times and said "I'm sorry", I felt your sincerity. It was as if you were saying "We are on the same side of democracy." He added: "I am a citizen who accepted your greetings and a reporter who interviewed me. I will always remember the words you protected in the dawn of the democratic republic. Please complete your military service in good health and return to our society as a healthy young man. Thank you."

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
According to Australia's ABC News:
South Korea's political unrest has become a trending topic on Weibo and TikTok, with Weibo now having over 300 million views, while the traditionally tough Chinese censors appear to have done little to suppress discussion
TikTok and Weibo's trending search rankings are second only to General Secretary XiğŸ¤£

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: South Korea's Chosun Ilbo reported that on December 4th local time, after the South Korean parliament passed a resolution calling for the "lifting of martial law", the leaders of the two major ruling and opposition parties in South Korea were filmed shaking hands and talking on the spot.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Video supplement: 
A young man from the martial law troops bowed his head to the citizens and said, "I'm sorry."

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: The six opposition parties in South Korea have jointly filed an impeachment case against President Yoon Seok-yeol and submitted it to the National Assembly. The impeachment case was formally reported to the National Assembly on the 5th, and a vote is expected on the 6th of this month.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
In the early morning of December 4, South Koreans gathered outside the National Assembly and shouted: Arrest Yoon Seok-yeol

Chinese media broadcast the scene live, but closed the comment section.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Zhao Chu, an expert on international military issues, commented on the South Korean president's declaration of martial law: The number one reason for the rapid farce of martial law was the restraint of the military and police.
Why did the military and police show such a high degree of restraint? Because through the historical criticism of Chun Doo-hwan, Roh Tae-woo and Park Chung-hee's regime, the transitional justice constructed by this series of actions has allowed the concept of democracy to take root in society and institutionalized the undue desires of the uniformed departments.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: Some netizens replaced the country in the martial law order issued by Yoon Seok-yeol with China and found that China had been under martial law.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
December 1, Guangdong. The man visited the abandoned makeshift hospital with his friends. Viewed from a high altitude, hundreds of cabins are densely packed, like a forest. The place has long been deserted, and there are still items left behind by people in the room, as if human beings have disappeared from the earth.
 And this video also brought back the memories of those three years among netizens: "It's like coffins burying your and my youth."

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
On November 30, People's Daily Online released a video: What kind of wise words would Confucius say when he met Socrates? In the video, Confucius and Socrates talked about traditional Chinese culture, which caused netizens to mock.
Netizens responded: Why didn't Confucius meet "Ding Dong Chicken"?

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: A delegation of mainland students visited Tsinghua University this morning and TSMC Innovation Center in Hsinchu Science Park in the afternoon. Students of Tsinghua University gathered at the school gate, holding up slogans such as "No lies, dignity" on the Sitong Bridge to protest against the delegation.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
On December 3, a netizen asked a domestic AI: Tell me a joke about Huawei.
AI answered: Cook visited China and declared Apple's success at a reception. He also said that anyone can call iPhone garbage and the police will not arrest him.
Then Comrade Yu Chengdong said: Anyone can also call Apple garbage in a Huawei store and the police will not arrest him.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: December 4, Jinzhong, Shanxi. Ms. Bu, born in 1979, obtained a master's degree in engineering in 2008. At that time, Ms. Bu failed to replace her second-generation ID card in time, which led to her failure to take the doctoral exam. Later, she suffered from schizophrenia, and her family went to the school to take her home. In early 2010, Ms. Bu disappeared from home and has not been heard from since. Recently, with the help of volunteers, Ms. Bu found her family. Currently, Ms. Bu has a son and a daughter. The family plans to sell the house for her treatment.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
On December 4, Xinhua News Agency released a Weibo post: Always maintain awe for the Constitution and laws
"December 4 is the 11th National Constitution Day. General Secretary Xi Jinping pointed out that we must uphold the authority and dignity of the Constitution and stressed that we must always maintain awe for the Constitution and laws."

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: At this moment, next to the Seoul City Hall in Seoul, South Korea, the people of Seoul are protesting against Yoon Seok-yeol.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: The Day a Post-00s Generation Got Stabbed in the Back

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
On December 4, the famous Taiwanese writer Qiong Yao committed suicide at home at the age of 86.
Qiong Yao's 63-year-old son said that his mother left a suicide note, in which Qiong Yao pointed out: The way I die is at the end of my life! Young people, don't give up life easily. A temporary setback may be the "training" of a beautiful life
Actress Zhao Wei also posted a message to mourn Qiong Yao.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: On December 4, South Korean people gathered at Gwanghwamun in downtown Seoul to protest and demand the resignation of President Yoon Seok-yeol.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: Supplement to the original video: After the traffic police stopped the car for inspection, the driver jumped out of the car and ran away. After being chased by the traffic police, he climbed over the guardrail and jumped off the overpass.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: At this moment, the people of Seoul gathered in front of the National Assembly and cheered, demanding that Yoon Seok-yeol step down.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
December 3 (Released) Zhengzhou, Henan. A woman posted a video saying that the traffic police in Dangdu were aggressive in enforcing the law, forcing her husband to jump off the overpass and causing his death.
The family members cried heartbreakingly, slapped the police and asked: You killed him!
The traffic police lowered his head and remained silent.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: December 3, Shenzhen, Guangdong. A woman posted a video saying that Meisha Kindergarten lets children wave machetes on the court every day to instill hate education. The woman scolded the teacher: This is instilling hate education, you should teach them love, but you teach them to kill at such a young age, but the staff in the school ignored the woman's words.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
December 3, Guangdong. A fruit stall owner was taking care of his child. When he saw the urban management, he immediately picked up the fruits outside the door.
The urban management walked straight to the stall and carried the fruits outside the door into the car and took them away. The whole set of movements was smooth and flowing.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: In the early morning of December 4, Seoul residents helped a congressman climb over the wall to enter the National Assembly to participate in the vote to lift martial law.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: December 3, Kunshan, Suzhou. Zhenchuan Good Man Park is a gathering place for "wall-hanging brothers". However, recently, a brother said that the park welded all the benches with steel pipes to prevent people from sleeping on the seats.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
On December 4, Xinhua News Agency published an article stating that the annual economic growth target for this year is 5%. We have been working hard towards this target. After hard work, we can actually accept a little bit to the left or right of 5%.
Netizens mocked, "If you can't achieve it, just say so directly" and "Putting on a brave face means that you can't achieve it."

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: South Korea's cabinet resigned en masse.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: On December 4, it was reported that Wen Shenghua, a 41-year-old Chinese student, was arrested in the United States on suspicion of exporting weapons to North Korea. The U.S. Department of Justice accused him and his co-conspirators of hiding guns and ammunition in containers and transporting weapons from the United States to North Korea via Hong Kong. U.S. law enforcement seized 50,000 rounds of 9mm bullets from his home. The bullets were stored in a truck parked in the driveway. He could face up to 20 years in prison for violating U.S. sanctions.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Jimmy Lai, founder of Next Media, and three companies of Apple Daily, entered the 102nd day of trial today for conspiracy to collude with foreign forces.
The defense asked: "Do you love China?"
Jimmy Lai: It depends on the definition of China. If China is a country, he loves Chinese culture and people, but if China is a government, he cannot say he loves China. Lai said that the values of the Chinese government are in opposition to his values. He only loves the Chinese country, not the Chinese government.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
December 3 (Release) A video of a man imitating a Chinese diplomat answering a question irrelevantly was circulated on social platforms. Currently, Douyin is gradually deleting the video.
Netizens responded: "Why do I feel like it's a press conference?"

Netizens responded: "Only Lu Xun could be born in that era, try it now, no one dares to write"

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. lawmakers have concluded a two-year investigation into the COVID-19 pandemic that has killed 1.1 million people in the United States, backing the theory that the virus may have leaked from a Chinese laboratory.

content: According to the Hankook Ilbo, South Korean President Yoon Seok-yeol will deliver a speech on Thursday local time.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: On December 3, Zhou Xiaoping, a member of the 14th National Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference, wrote: I advise Musk to read Su Qin and Zhang Yi first, then read Wang Anshi's reform, and finally think carefully about where to go. Musk's problem is that he over-trusts personal power and ignores that the evolution of history is not driven by a few people, but determined by the majority. Mao Zedong had already made a brilliant statement on this point in his poems.
